owl:Ontology.dc:abstract: An ontology for describing software and their links to inputs, outputs and variables
owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Daniel Garijo
Varun Ratnakar
Yolanda Gil
Deborah Khider
owl:Ontology.dc:title: The Software Description Ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: An ontology for describing software and their links to inputs, outputs and variables

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Parameter that can be adjusted in a configuration setup
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: adjustable parameter

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links parameter with the variable they adjust. This property can be used when parameters quantify variables without directly representing them. For example, a "fertilizer percentage adjustment" parameter can quantify a "fertilizer price" variable
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: adjusts variable

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links a software component to other useful software that canbe used to visualize its outputs
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: compatible visualization software

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to identify the original source of the information of the annotated resource. It could be a web page, an organization, a person, some experiment notes, etc.
had primary source
Property that links a model to one of its configurations. A model may have multiple configurations, each of which is unique in terms of the inputs and outputs it uses.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has configuration

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a dataset specification to the data structure definition
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has file structure

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links a parameter or an input to a fixed value. For example, in a given configuration a parameter with the planting date for a model could be fixed to avoid the user changing it for that region.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has fixed resource

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links a software project to its funding information
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has funding information

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links a model configuration to the input types expected by it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has input

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that expresses what are the outputs of a model
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has output

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates the parameters of a model configuration
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has parameter

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property designed to reference the elements included in a sample collection.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has part

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links an instance of a dataset (or a dataset specification) to the presentation of a variable contained (or expected to be contained) on it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has presentation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A typical sample visualization of the softwware outputs
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has sample visualization

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property used to define configurations with some fixed resources and values. The rationale of this property is to allow predefined configurations
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has setup

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Function to link a function with its corresponding container
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has software image

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: the standard name of a variable
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has standard variable

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Associates a presentation with a dataset where the presentation occurs
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: part of dataset

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates that a software component (or any of its outputs) can be used to calculate a particular index. The rationale for this property is that indices are usually calculated by applying post-processing steps to the outputs of a software component.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: useful for calculating index

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Property used to link a variable presentation or time interval to the unit they are represented in
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: uses unit

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: How to cite this software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: citation

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: URL to the code repository of a software component
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: code repository

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: An identifier for resources with metadata entries in a data catalog
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: data catalog identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A description of a resource
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: description

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Grant number used for funding
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: funding grant

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that constraints which values are accepted for a parameter. For example, the name of a crop can only be "Maize" or "Sorghum"
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has accepted values

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Assumptions of a software, e.g. the solver being used for a particular model, the source of the data (e.g., all data must have a given resolution), etc.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has assumption

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Location of the aggregation of all the files needed to execute the component. Usually a zip file including the run script and support scripts, including specification files
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has component location

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Constraint or rule associated to a variable or software configuration. For example: "This model accepts only monthly data", or "all inputs of this model configuration must share the same location". More structured restrictions, such as Jena rules or SWRL rules may also be captured with this property
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has constraint

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates the data type of a parameter
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has data type

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Default accepted value of a variable presentation (or a parameter)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has default value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to indicate dimensionality of the input or output of a dataset specification
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has dimensionality

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Pointer to the documentation of the model
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has documentation

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Download URL where to obtain the source/executable of the software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has download URL

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: An example explaining a scenario where the model was used in plain language.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has example

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Execution instructions on how to run the image
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has execution command

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Frequently asked questions about a software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has FAQ

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Value of a parameter in a software setup.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has fixed value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Format followed by a file. For example, txt, nc, etc.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has format

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that points to the main runnable script for the current function
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has implementation script location

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Instructions requires to install this particular piece of software.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has installation instructions

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Properties that relate the variable representation to its long name. The long name is useful for context (e.g., precipitation is less ambiguous than P) but not as precise as the standard name.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has long name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Maximum accepted value of a variable presentation (or a parameter)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has maximum accepted value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Minimum accepted value of a variable presentation (or a parameter)
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has minimum accepted value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Objective or main functionality that can be achieved by running this software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has purpose

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A short name (e.g., temperature) capturing the high-level concept of the variable
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has short name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that determines what are the increments (step size) that are commonly used to vary a parameter. This is commonly used for automatically setting up software tests. For example, if I want to set up a model and try 30 reasonable values on a parameter, I may use the default value and the step size to create the appropriate increments. If the step size is 0.1 and the default value is 0, then I will will be able to create setups: 0, 0.1, 0.2...2.9,3
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has step size

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that links to the location of scripts that may be used from the main runnable script.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has support script location

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property that describes the usage considerations of a particular software. These notes capture the rationale of for that software configuration, along with an explanation for sample inputs, things to consider when running the model with data, etc.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has usage notes

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Identifier of the version of this software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: has version id

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Identifier of the resource being described
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: identifier

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Keywords associated with a software component
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: keywords

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: License of a software component or its source code
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: license

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Name of the resource
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: name

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Position of the parameter or input/output in the model configuration. This property is needed to know how to organize the I/O of the component on execution
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: position

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Value that represents how a parameter should be incremented on each iteration of a software component execution. This value is important when preparing execution ensembles automatically, e.g., simulating crop production varying the parameter "fertilizer amount" in increments of 10%.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: recommended increment

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Main publication to cite in this software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: reference publication

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: A summarized description of the resource
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: short description

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Property to link details, such as mailing lists in case a contact person is not provided
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: support details

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Tag used to annotate a version or a software configuration. This annotation is useful to show which version is the latest, or which version is deprecated. Supported tags are: "latest", "deprecated"
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: tag

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Value associated to the described entity
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: value

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Website of the software
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: website

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Special type of configuration in which some of the inputs or parameters are associated to files or values. A configuration may be associated to multiple setups to facilitate its execution.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Configuration Setup

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class designed to describe a type of input or output used or produced by a model. For example, Topoflow has several inputs. One of them is a text file with precipitation values. The representation of this input is an instance of a dataset specification.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset Specification

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A class to represent the funding information of a software project
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Funding Information

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Variable that follows the ICASA standard for agriculture: https://dssat.net/data/standards_v2
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ICASA Variable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An image (e.g. tiff file) is a type of dataset specification used to define things like soil, crops, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Image

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A number (such as a ratio) derived from a series of observations and used as an indicator or measure (https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/index)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Numerical Index

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An organized ody of people with a particular purpose
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Organization

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A parameter of the model.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Parameter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Variable that follows the Scientific Variables Ontology: http://geoscienceontology.org/
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SVO Variable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A collection of resources that are used as sample for running a sfoware component multiple times
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sample Collection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sample execution of a given software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sample Execution

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A sample resource associated with a software
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sample Resource

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A software configuration represents a particular way of invoking a function of a software component. A software configuration exposes the precise inputs and outputs that are used for that function. Multiple software configurations may be associated to a software component. A software configuration facilitates the encapsulation of software, and it can be used to represent components of scientific workflows.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Configuration

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An image that virtualizes the functionality of a given software. For example, a Docker container.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Image

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A software version is a specificf type of software that represents a particular set of functionalities. New functionalities and error fixes may occur between software versions
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Software Version

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class representing the characteristics of the code associated with a software component
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Source Code

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A standard variable, necessary to refer to all the variable using the same nomenclature in a domain ontology
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Standard Variable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class designed to distinguish the different types of units that are available in variables from datasets or parameters
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Unit

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A symbol that represents a quanity in a dataset or dataset specification
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Variable

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Concept used to represent an instantiation of a variable in an input/output dataset. For example, a model A may use an input file with temperature expressed in Farenheit (variablePresentation1), while a model B may produce an output with temperature in Celsius (variablePresentation2). Both variable presentations refer to the concept of temperature.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Variable presentation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Class to represent any type of visualization related to a software. For example, a dynamic HTML page, a video, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Visualization
